definition: to live together in harmony
appearance/portrait/picture/government minister/(physics) phase/(literary) to appraise (esp. by scrutinizing physical features)/to read sb's fortune (by physiognomy, palmistry etc)
each other/one another/mutually/fret on the neck of a pipa 琵琶[pi2 pa5] (a fret on the soundboard is called a 品[pin3])
surname Xiang
content/calm/still/quiet/safe/secure/in good health/to find a place for/to install/to fix/to fit/to bring (a charge against sb)/to pacify/to harbor (good intentions)/security/safety/peace/ampere
surname An
not to have/no/none/not/to lack/un-/-less
matter/thing/item/work/affair/CL:件[jian4],樁|桩[zhuang1],回[hui2]

sentences.english: Gold and glass get along well enough and under the right circumstances will attract.
sentences.chinese: 金子和玻璃相安無事，特定環境下它們互相吸引。

sentences.english: But the president's role as commander in chief cut two ways.
sentences.chinese: 但是，總統的角色與統帥的職責無法相安無事。

sentences.english: As long for a little bit let she 1:00, basically tin live attach peacefully.
sentences.chinese: 只要稍微讓着她一點，基本上就能相安無事了。

sentences.english: The little guys got along just fine while the big guys were fighting.
sentences.chinese: 在大人物打仗的時候，這些小人物卻相安無事。

definition: many men, a great force (idiom); many hands provide great strength/There is safety in numbers.
to sleep peacefully (idiom)/(fig.) to rest easy/to be free of worries
to rack one's brains (idiom); to take great pains to think sth through
to strive for favor
to die of old age/to die in one's bed at a ripe old age
to see, hear and obey (idiom); to take advice/to take sb at his word
to gain nothing/to end up empty-handed
to fail to grasp the main points
to discuss spiritedly (idiom)/tongues are wagging
to throw one's life in for/to haplessly give one's life for/to sacrifice oneself torturously working for another or for a group/to pour in one's utmost effort/to shed one's last ounce of strength for
to have lingering fears/trepidation remaining after a trauma (idiom)
to remain unmoved
to be determined to win (idiom)
to ask for trouble/to invite difficulties
to turn a blind eye to
lit. to return to office after living as a hermit on Mount Dongshan (idiom); fig. to make a comeback
